comments:
Trying to run M4 results in a 

JVM Terminated. Exit Code=1
C:\windows\system32\javaw.exe
-cp c:\Programme\eclipse\startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
-os win32 
-ws win32 
-arch x86 
-showsplash c:\programme\eclipse\eclipse.exe -showsplash 600

Strangely it seems to be ingoring the installed VM and trying to use microsoft 
VM (and we know what that means) 

I tried to start it with .. 

c:\jdk1.3.1_09\bin\java.exe -cp c:\Programme\eclipse\startup.jar 
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

But I get the following exception: 
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalAccessError: try to access method 
java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Ljava/io/File;Z)V from class 
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.isAlreadyRunning(Main.java:1502)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:595)

Nothing I do seems to get it running, however 2.1 and 3.0M3 both run fine.

I also tried ... 
C:\Programme\eclipse\eclipse.exe -vm %JAVA_HOME%\bin\java.exe -
data "\\zts10.muc\QX33628\eclipse"

This netted the same results.

It seems that it is crashing when trying to create the lock file ? It creates 
the workspace/.metadata directory but then nothing more.

M4 requires JDK 1.4.

http://download2.eclipse.org/downloads/drops/S-3.0M4-200310101454/index.php

states "You will need a 1.4 level Java runtime or Java development kit (JDK)
installed on your machine in order to run Eclipse."

Closing as invalid. As mentioned above, Eclipse 3.0 requires a 1.4 level VM. A
separate bug was open so the launcher is updated to provide a proper message
when a VM lower than 1.4 is used (see bug 44814)

Ho will this jive with the millions of corporate developers working on JDK 
1.3.1 based code? Id love to convert BMW to 1.4 but that would be something 
like trying to convince all politicians to be honest.

traces.message: try to access method  java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Ljava/io/File;Z)V from class  org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main
